65  /**
66   * An abstract IPC service, supporting SASL authentication of connections,
67   * using GSSAPI for Kerberos authentication or DIGEST-MD5 for authentication
68   * via signed tokens.
69   *
70   * <p>
71   * This is part of the {@link SecureRpcEngine} implementation.
72   * </p>
73   *
74   * @see org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.SecureClient
75   */
76  public abstract class SecureServer extends HBaseServer {
77    private final boolean authorize;
78    private boolean isSecurityEnabled;
79  
80    /**
81     * The first four bytes of secure RPC connections
82     */
83    public static final ByteBuffer HEADER = ByteBuffer.wrap("srpc".getBytes());
84  
85    // 1 : Introduce ping and server does not throw away RPCs
86    // 3 : Introduce the protocol into the RPC connection header
87    // 4 : Introduced SASL security layer
88    public static final byte CURRENT_VERSION = 4;
89    public static final Set<Byte> INSECURE_VERSIONS = ImmutableSet.of((byte) 3);
90  
91    public static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(SecureServer.class);
92    private static final Log AUDITLOG = LogFactory.getLog("SecurityLogger." +
93      SecureServer.class.getName());
94  
95    private static final String AUTH_FAILED_FOR = "Auth failed for ";
96    private static final String AUTH_SUCCESSFUL_FOR = "Auth successful for ";
97  
98    protected SecretManager<TokenIdentifier> secretManager;
99    protected ServiceAuthorizationManager authManager;

101   protected class SecureCall extends HBaseServer.Call {
102     public SecureCall(int id, Writable param, Connection connection,
103         Responder responder, long size) {
104       super(id, param, connection, responder, size);
105     }
106 
107     @Override
108     protected synchronized void setResponse(Object value, Status status,
109         String errorClass, String error) {
110       Writable result = null;
111       if (value instanceof Writable) {
112         result = (Writable) value;
113       } else {
114         /* We might have a null value and errors. Avoid creating a
115          * HbaseObjectWritable, because the constructor fails on null. */
116         if (value != null) {
117           result = new HbaseObjectWritable(value);
118         }
119       }
120 
121       int size = BUFFER_INITIAL_SIZE;
122       if (result instanceof WritableWithSize) {
123         // get the size hint.
124         WritableWithSize ohint = (WritableWithSize) result;
125         long hint = ohint.getWritableSize() + Bytes.SIZEOF_INT + Bytes.SIZEOF_INT;
126         if (hint > Integer.MAX_VALUE) {
127           // oops, new problem.
128           IOException ioe =
129             new IOException("Result buffer size too large: " + hint);
130           errorClass = ioe.getClass().getName();
131           error = StringUtils.stringifyException(ioe);
132         } else {
133           size = (int)hint;
134         }
135       }
136 
137       ByteBufferOutputStream buf = new ByteBufferOutputStream(size);
138       DataOutputStream out = new DataOutputStream(buf);
139       try {
140         out.writeInt(this.id);                // write call id
141         out.writeInt(status.state);           // write status
142       } catch (IOException e) {
143         errorClass = e.getClass().getName();
144         error = StringUtils.stringifyException(e);
145       }
146 
147       try {
148         if (status == Status.SUCCESS) {
149           result.write(out);
150         } else {
151           WritableUtils.writeString(out, errorClass);
152           WritableUtils.writeString(out, error);
153         }
154         if (((SecureConnection)connection).useWrap) {
155           wrapWithSasl(buf);
156         }
157       } catch (IOException e) {
158         LOG.warn("Error sending response to call: ", e);
159       }
160 
161       this.response = buf.getByteBuffer();
162     }
163 
164     private void wrapWithSasl(ByteBufferOutputStream response)
165         throws IOException {
166       if (((SecureConnection)connection).useSasl) {
167         // getByteBuffer calls flip()
168         ByteBuffer buf = response.getByteBuffer();
169         byte[] token;
170         // synchronization may be needed since there can be multiple Handler
171         // threads using saslServer to wrap responses.
172         synchronized (((SecureConnection)connection).saslServer) {
173           token = ((SecureConnection)connection).saslServer.wrap(buf.array(),
174               buf.arrayOffset(), buf.remaining());
175         }
176         if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
177           LOG.trace("Adding saslServer wrapped token of size " + token.length
178               + " as call response.");
179         }
180         buf.clear();
181         DataOutputStream saslOut = new DataOutputStream(response);
182         saslOut.writeInt(token.length);
183         saslOut.write(token, 0, token.length);
184       }
185     }
186   }
187 
188   /** Reads calls from a connection and queues them for handling. */
189   public class SecureConnection extends HBaseServer.Connection  {
190     private boolean rpcHeaderRead = false; // if initial rpc header is read
191     private boolean headerRead = false;  //if the connection header that
192                                          //follows version is read.
193     private ByteBuffer data;
194     private ByteBuffer dataLengthBuffer;
195     protected final LinkedList<SecureCall> responseQueue;
196     private int dataLength;
197     private InetAddress addr;
198 
199     boolean useSasl;
200     SaslServer saslServer;
201     private AuthMethod authMethod;
202     private boolean saslContextEstablished;
203     private boolean skipInitialSaslHandshake;
204     private ByteBuffer rpcHeaderBuffer;
205     private ByteBuffer unwrappedData;
206     private ByteBuffer unwrappedDataLengthBuffer;
207 
208     public UserGroupInformation attemptingUser = null; // user name before auth
209 
210     // Fake 'call' for failed authorization response
211     private final int AUTHORIZATION_FAILED_CALLID = -1;
212     // Fake 'call' for SASL context setup
213     private static final int SASL_CALLID = -33;
214     private final SecureCall saslCall = new SecureCall(SASL_CALLID, null, this, null, 0);
215 
216     private boolean useWrap = false;
217 
218     public SecureConnection(SocketChannel channel, long lastContact) {
219       super(channel, lastContact);
220       this.header = new SecureConnectionHeader();
221       this.channel = channel;
222       this.data = null;
223       this.dataLengthBuffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(4);
224       this.unwrappedData = null;
225       this.unwrappedDataLengthBuffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(4);
226       this.socket = channel.socket();
227       this.addr = socket.getInetAddress();
228       this.responseQueue = new LinkedList<SecureCall>();
229     }

231     @Override
232     public String toString() {
233       return getHostAddress() + ":" + remotePort;
234     }

237       return hostAddress;
238     }

241       return addr;

244     private User getAuthorizedUgi(String authorizedId)
245         throws IOException {
246       if (authMethod == AuthMethod.DIGEST) {
247         TokenIdentifier tokenId = HBaseSaslRpcServer.getIdentifier(authorizedId,
248             secretManager);
249         UserGroupInformation ugi = tokenId.getUser();
250         if (ugi == null) {
251           throw new AccessControlException(
252               "Can't retrieve username from tokenIdentifier.");
253         }
254         ugi.addTokenIdentifier(tokenId);
255         return User.create(ugi);
256       } else {
257         return User.create(UserGroupInformation.createRemoteUser(authorizedId));
258       }
259     }
260 
261     private void saslReadAndProcess(byte[] saslToken) throws IOException,
262         InterruptedException {
263       if (!saslContextEstablished) {
264         byte[] replyToken = null;
265         try {
266           if (saslServer == null) {
267             switch (authMethod) {
268             case DIGEST:
269               if (secretManager == null) {
270                 throw new AccessControlException(
271                     "Server is not configured to do DIGEST authentication.");
272               }
273               saslServer = Sasl.createSaslServer(AuthMethod.DIGEST
274                   .getMechanismName(), null, HBaseSaslRpcServer.SASL_DEFAULT_REALM,
275                   HBaseSaslRpcServer.SASL_PROPS, new SaslDigestCallbackHandler(
276                       secretManager, this));
277               break;
278             default:
279               UserGroupInformation current = UserGroupInformation
280                   .getCurrentUser();
281               String fullName = current.getUserName();
282               if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
283                 LOG.trace("Kerberos principal name is " + fullName);
284               }
285               final String names[] = HBaseSaslRpcServer.splitKerberosName(fullName);
286               if (names.length != 3) {
287                 throw new AccessControlException(
288                     "Kerberos principal name does NOT have the expected "
289                         + "hostname part: " + fullName);
290               }
291               current.doAs(new PrivilegedExceptionAction<Object>() {
292                 @Override
293                 public Object run() throws SaslException {
294                   saslServer = Sasl.createSaslServer(AuthMethod.KERBEROS
295                       .getMechanismName(), names[0], names[1],
296                       HBaseSaslRpcServer.SASL_PROPS, new SaslGssCallbackHandler());
297                   return null;
298                 }
299               });
300             }
301             if (saslServer == null)
302               throw new AccessControlException(
303                   "Unable to find SASL server implementation for "
304                       + authMethod.getMechanismName());
305             if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
306               LOG.trace("Created SASL server with mechanism = "
307                   + authMethod.getMechanismName());
308             }
309           }
310           if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
311             LOG.trace("Have read input token of size " + saslToken.length
312                 + " for processing by saslServer.evaluateResponse()");
313           }
314           replyToken = saslServer.evaluateResponse(saslToken);
315         } catch (IOException e) {
316           IOException sendToClient = e;
317           Throwable cause = e;
318           while (cause != null) {
319             if (cause instanceof InvalidToken) {
320               sendToClient = (InvalidToken) cause;
321               break;
322             }
323             cause = cause.getCause();
324           }
325           doSaslReply(SaslStatus.ERROR, null, sendToClient.getClass().getName(),
326               sendToClient.getLocalizedMessage());
327           rpcMetrics.authenticationFailures.inc();
328           String clientIP = this.toString();
329           // attempting user could be null
330           AUDITLOG.warn(AUTH_FAILED_FOR + clientIP + ":" + attemptingUser);
331           throw e;
332         }
333         if (replyToken != null) {
334           if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
335             LOG.trace("Will send token of size " + replyToken.length
336                 + " from saslServer.");
337           }
338           doSaslReply(SaslStatus.SUCCESS, new BytesWritable(replyToken), null,
339               null);
340         }
341         if (saslServer.isComplete()) {
342           if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
343             LOG.debug("SASL server context established. Negotiated QoP is "
344               + saslServer.getNegotiatedProperty(Sasl.QOP));
345           }
346           String qop = (String) saslServer.getNegotiatedProperty(Sasl.QOP);
347           useWrap = qop != null && !"auth".equalsIgnoreCase(qop);
348           ticket = getAuthorizedUgi(saslServer.getAuthorizationID());
349           if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
350             LOG.debug("SASL server successfully authenticated client: " + ticket);
351           }
352           rpcMetrics.authenticationSuccesses.inc();
353           AUDITLOG.info(AUTH_SUCCESSFUL_FOR + ticket);
354           saslContextEstablished = true;
355         }
356       } else {
357         if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
358           LOG.trace("Have read input token of size " + saslToken.length
359               + " for processing by saslServer.unwrap()");
360         }
361         if (!useWrap) {
362           processOneRpc(saslToken);
363         } else {
364           byte[] plaintextData = saslServer.unwrap(saslToken, 0,
365               saslToken.length);
366           processUnwrappedData(plaintextData);
367         }
368       }
369     }
370 
371     private void doSaslReply(SaslStatus status, Writable rv,
372         String errorClass, String error) throws IOException {
373       saslCall.setResponse(rv,
374           status == SaslStatus.SUCCESS ? Status.SUCCESS : Status.ERROR,
375            errorClass, error);
376       saslCall.responder = responder;
377       saslCall.sendResponseIfReady();
378     }
379 
380     private void disposeSasl() {
381       if (saslServer != null) {
382         try {
383           saslServer.dispose();
384         } catch (SaslException ignored) {
385         }
386       }
387     }

389     public int readAndProcess() throws IOException, InterruptedException {
390       while (true) {
391         /* Read at most one RPC. If the header is not read completely yet
392          * then iterate until we read first RPC or until there is no data left.
393          */
394         int count = -1;
395         if (dataLengthBuffer.remaining() > 0) {
396           count = channelRead(channel, dataLengthBuffer);
397           if (count < 0 || dataLengthBuffer.remaining() > 0)
398             return count;
399         }
400 
401         if (!rpcHeaderRead) {
402           //Every connection is expected to send the header.
403           if (rpcHeaderBuffer == null) {
404             rpcHeaderBuffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(2);
405           }
406           count = channelRead(channel, rpcHeaderBuffer);
407           if (count < 0 || rpcHeaderBuffer.remaining() > 0) {
408             return count;
409           }
410           int version = rpcHeaderBuffer.get(0);
411           byte[] method = new byte[] {rpcHeaderBuffer.get(1)};
412           authMethod = AuthMethod.read(new DataInputStream(
413               new ByteArrayInputStream(method)));
414           dataLengthBuffer.flip();
415           if (!HEADER.equals(dataLengthBuffer) || version != CURRENT_VERSION) {
416             //Warning is ok since this is not supposed to happen.
417             if (INSECURE_VERSIONS.contains(version)) {
418               LOG.warn("An insecure client (version '" + version + "') is attempting to connect " +
419                   " to this version '" + CURRENT_VERSION + "' secure server from " +
420                   hostAddress + ":" + remotePort);
421             } else {
422               LOG.warn("Incorrect header or version mismatch from " +
423                   hostAddress + ":" + remotePort +
424                   " got version " + version +
425                   " expected version " + CURRENT_VERSION);              
426             }
427             
428             return -1;
429           }
430           dataLengthBuffer.clear();
431           if (authMethod == null) {
432             throw new IOException("Unable to read authentication method");
433           }
434           if (isSecurityEnabled && authMethod == AuthMethod.SIMPLE) {
435             AccessControlException ae = new AccessControlException(
436                 "Authentication is required");
437             SecureCall failedCall = new SecureCall(AUTHORIZATION_FAILED_CALLID, null, this,
438                 null, 0);
439             failedCall.setResponse(null, Status.FATAL, ae.getClass().getName(),
440                 ae.getMessage());
441             responder.doRespond(failedCall);
442             throw ae;
443           }
444           if (!isSecurityEnabled && authMethod != AuthMethod.SIMPLE) {
445             doSaslReply(SaslStatus.SUCCESS, new IntWritable(
446                 HBaseSaslRpcServer.SWITCH_TO_SIMPLE_AUTH), null, null);
447             authMethod = AuthMethod.SIMPLE;
448             // client has already sent the initial Sasl message and we
449             // should ignore it. Both client and server should fall back
450             // to simple auth from now on.
451             skipInitialSaslHandshake = true;
452           }
453           if (authMethod != AuthMethod.SIMPLE) {
454             useSasl = true;
455           }
456 
457           rpcHeaderBuffer = null;
458           rpcHeaderRead = true;
459           continue;
460         }
461 
462         if (data == null) {
463           dataLengthBuffer.flip();
464           dataLength = dataLengthBuffer.getInt();
465 
466           if (dataLength == HBaseClient.PING_CALL_ID) {
467             if(!useWrap) { //covers the !useSasl too
468               dataLengthBuffer.clear();
469               return 0;  //ping message
470             }
471           }
472           if (dataLength < 0) {
473             LOG.warn("Unexpected data length " + dataLength + "!! from " +
474                 getHostAddress());
475           }
476           data = ByteBuffer.allocate(dataLength);
477           incRpcCount();  // Increment the rpc count
478         }
479 
480         count = channelRead(channel, data);
481 
482         if (data.remaining() == 0) {
483           dataLengthBuffer.clear();
484           data.flip();
485           if (skipInitialSaslHandshake) {
486             data = null;
487             skipInitialSaslHandshake = false;
488             continue;
489           }
490           boolean isHeaderRead = headerRead;
491           if (useSasl) {
492             saslReadAndProcess(data.array());
493           } else {
494             processOneRpc(data.array());
495           }
496           data = null;
497           if (!isHeaderRead) {
498             continue;
499           }
500         }
501         return count;
502       }
503     }
504 
505     /// Reads the connection header following version
506     private void processHeader(byte[] buf) throws IOException {
507       DataInputStream in =
508         new DataInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(buf));
509       header.readFields(in);
510       try {
511         String protocolClassName = header.getProtocol();
512         if (protocolClassName != null) {
513           protocol = getProtocolClass(header.getProtocol(), conf);
514         }
515       } catch (ClassNotFoundException cnfe) {
516         throw new IOException("Unknown protocol: " + header.getProtocol());
517       }
518 
519       User protocolUser = header.getUser();
520       if (!useSasl) {
521         ticket = protocolUser;
522         if (ticket != null) {
523           ticket.getUGI().setAuthenticationMethod(AuthMethod.SIMPLE.authenticationMethod);
524         }
525       } else {
526         // user is authenticated
527         ticket.getUGI().setAuthenticationMethod(authMethod.authenticationMethod);
528         //Now we check if this is a proxy user case. If the protocol user is
529         //different from the 'user', it is a proxy user scenario. However,
530         //this is not allowed if user authenticated with DIGEST.
531         if ((protocolUser != null)
532             && (!protocolUser.getName().equals(ticket.getName()))) {
533           if (authMethod == AuthMethod.DIGEST) {
534             // Not allowed to doAs if token authentication is used
535             throw new AccessControlException("Authenticated user (" + ticket
536                 + ") doesn't match what the client claims to be ("
537                 + protocolUser + ")");
538           } else {
539             // Effective user can be different from authenticated user
540             // for simple auth or kerberos auth
541             // The user is the real user. Now we create a proxy user
542             UserGroupInformation realUser = ticket.getUGI();
543             ticket = User.create(
544                 UserGroupInformation.createProxyUser(protocolUser.getName(),
545                     realUser));
546             // Now the user is a proxy user, set Authentication method Proxy.
547             ticket.getUGI().setAuthenticationMethod(AuthenticationMethod.PROXY);
548           }
549         }
550       }
551     }
552 
553     private void processUnwrappedData(byte[] inBuf) throws IOException,
554         InterruptedException {
555       ReadableByteChannel ch = Channels.newChannel(new ByteArrayInputStream(
556           inBuf));
557       // Read all RPCs contained in the inBuf, even partial ones
558       while (true) {
559         int count = -1;
560         if (unwrappedDataLengthBuffer.remaining() > 0) {
561           count = channelRead(ch, unwrappedDataLengthBuffer);
562           if (count <= 0 || unwrappedDataLengthBuffer.remaining() > 0)
563             return;
564         }
565 
566         if (unwrappedData == null) {
567           unwrappedDataLengthBuffer.flip();
568           int unwrappedDataLength = unwrappedDataLengthBuffer.getInt();
569 
570           if (unwrappedDataLength == HBaseClient.PING_CALL_ID) {
571             if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
572               LOG.trace("Received ping message");
573             }
574             unwrappedDataLengthBuffer.clear();
575             continue; // ping message
576           }
577           unwrappedData = ByteBuffer.allocate(unwrappedDataLength);
578         }
579 
580         count = channelRead(ch, unwrappedData);
581         if (count <= 0 || unwrappedData.remaining() > 0)
582           return;
583 
584         if (unwrappedData.remaining() == 0) {
585           unwrappedDataLengthBuffer.clear();
586           unwrappedData.flip();
587           processOneRpc(unwrappedData.array());
588           unwrappedData = null;
589         }
590       }
591     }
592 
593     private void processOneRpc(byte[] buf) throws IOException,
594         InterruptedException {
595       if (headerRead) {
596         processData(buf);
597       } else {
598         processHeader(buf);
599         headerRead = true;
600         if (!authorizeConnection()) {
601           throw new AccessControlException("Connection from " + this
602               + " for protocol " + header.getProtocol()
603               + " is unauthorized for user " + ticket);
604         }
605       }
606     }
607 
608     protected void processData(byte[] buf) throws  IOException, InterruptedException {
609       DataInputStream dis =
610         new DataInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(buf));
611       int id = dis.readInt();                    // try to read an id
612 
613       if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
614         LOG.trace(" got #" + id);
615       }
616 
617       Writable param = ReflectionUtils.newInstance(paramClass, conf);           // read param
618       param.readFields(dis);
619 
620       SecureCall call = new SecureCall(id, param, this, responder, buf.length);
621 
622       if (priorityCallQueue != null && getQosLevel(param) > highPriorityLevel) {
623         priorityCallQueue.put(call);
624         updateCallQueueLenMetrics(priorityCallQueue);
625       } else if (replicationQueue != null && getQosLevel(param) == HConstants.REPLICATION_QOS) {
626         replicationQueue.put(call);
627         updateCallQueueLenMetrics(replicationQueue);
628       } else {
629         callQueue.put(call);              // queue the call; maybe blocked here
630         updateCallQueueLenMetrics(callQueue);
631       }
632     }
633 
634     private boolean authorizeConnection() throws IOException {
635       try {
636         // If auth method is DIGEST, the token was obtained by the
637         // real user for the effective user, therefore not required to
638         // authorize real user. doAs is allowed only for simple or kerberos
639         // authentication
640         if (ticket != null && ticket.getUGI().getRealUser() != null
641             && (authMethod != AuthMethod.DIGEST)) {
642           ProxyUsers.authorize(ticket.getUGI(), this.getHostAddress(), conf);
643         }
644         authorize(ticket, header, getHostInetAddress());
645         if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
646           LOG.debug("Successfully authorized " + header);
647         }
648         rpcMetrics.authorizationSuccesses.inc();
649       } catch (AuthorizationException ae) {
650         if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
651           LOG.debug("Connection authorization failed: "+ae.getMessage(), ae);
652         }
653         rpcMetrics.authorizationFailures.inc();
654         SecureCall failedCall = new SecureCall(AUTHORIZATION_FAILED_CALLID, null, this,
655             null, 0);
656         failedCall.setResponse(null, Status.FATAL, ae.getClass().getName(),
657             ae.getMessage());
658         responder.doRespond(failedCall);
659         return false;
660       }
661       return true;
662     }
663 
664     protected synchronized void close() {
665       disposeSasl();
666       data = null;
667       dataLengthBuffer = null;
668       if (!channel.isOpen())
669         return;
670       try {socket.shutdownOutput();} catch(Exception ignored) {} // FindBugs DE_MIGHT_IGNORE
671       if (channel.isOpen()) {
672         try {channel.close();} catch(Exception ignored) {}
673       }
674       try {socket.close();} catch(Exception ignored) {}
675     }
676   }

732   /**
733    * Authorize the incoming client connection.
734    *
735    * @param user client user
736    * @param connection incoming connection
737    * @param addr InetAddress of incoming connection
738    * @throws org.apache.hadoop.security.authorize.AuthorizationException when the client isn't authorized to talk the protocol
739    */
740   public void authorize(User user,
741                         ConnectionHeader connection,
742                         InetAddress addr
743                         ) throws AuthorizationException {
744     if (authorize) {
745       Class<?> protocol = null;
746       try {
747         protocol = getProtocolClass(connection.getProtocol(), getConf());
748       } catch (ClassNotFoundException cfne) {
749         throw new AuthorizationException("Unknown protocol: " +
750                                          connection.getProtocol());
751       }
752       authManager.authorize(user != null ? user.getUGI() : null,
753           protocol, getConf(), addr);
754     }
755   }
